page.title: 05Birchover School
page.content: Birchover School is 101 years old. It is the smallest school in Derbyshire. There are only seven pupils, six boys and one girl aged from five to seven years, and one teacher. There are just two rooms, a classroom heated by a coal stove and a kitchen. The varied equipment includes a cooker, woodwork tools, a computer, percussion instruments, Lego and many books. The Centenary was on 21st January 1984. There was a party for everyone in Birchover and the pupils received a goblet with a picture of the School engraved on it. The School bell was re-hung and rung on the day. Later in the year there was an exhib- ition of old documents and photographs illustrating the life of the school and village from 1884-1984.
